      • FormatTable

        public static String FormatTable(String tableName,
                 String[] myTable,
                 String fieldSep,
                 String commentIdentifier,
                 int CommentedRowBehaviour,
                 String regex)
                          throws TextFormatException
        Format a text table addind the right number of space to the table columns
        Parameters:
        tableName - Tha name of the table
        myTable - The table as a string array
        fieldSep - Fields separator
        commentIdentifier - Comment identifier
        CommentedRowBehaviour - 0 = commented row not considered, 1 = try to format commented rows, 2 = delete commented rows
        regex - Regular expression to remove. If formed by several consecutives field separator (i.e. ",,,,,")
        Returns:
        A string representing the formatted table
        Throws:
        TextFormatException

      • removeDirectory

        public static boolean removeDirectory(File directory)
        Remove a directory and all of its contents. The results of executing File.delete() on a File object that represents a directory seems to be platform dependent. This method removes the directory and all of its contents.
        Returns:
        true if the complete directory was removed, false if it could not be. If false is returned then some of the files in the directory may have been removed.

      • removeDirectoryContent

        public static boolean removeDirectoryContent(File directory)
        Remove the contents of a directory. The results of executing File.delete() on a File object that represents a directory seems to be platform dependent. This method removes the directory and all of its contents.
        Returns:
        true if the complete directory was removed, false if it could not be. If false is returned then some of the files in the directory may have been removed.

      • subArrayIndexOf

        public static int[] subArrayIndexOf(Object[] v1,
                    Object[] v2)
        check if v2 is contained in v1 and return the indexes of its occurence. The index return is the index in v1 of the first element of v2. If v1 is null or empty or v2 is null or empty or is longer than v1 return null. If no occurence of v2 is in v1 then return null.
        Parameters:
        v1 - Array in which search
        v2 - Array to search
        Returns:

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        v1 - Array in which search
        v2 - Array to search
